criteria.title: Figure 1 in Schizanthines N, O, and P, Tropane Alkaloids from the Aerial Parts ofSchizanthus tricolor
criteria.description: Figure 1. Structures of tropane alkaloids present in the genus Schizanthus: (a) angeloyl, (b) senecioyl, (c) tigloyl, (d) methylitaconyl, (e) methylmesaconyl, and (f) methylcitraconyl moieties (R1/ R2).
criteria.notes: Published as part of Humam, Munir, Kehrli, Thomas, Jeannerat, Damien, Muñoz, Orlando, Hostettmann, Kurt & Christen, Philippe, 2011, Schizanthines N, O, and P, Tropane Alkaloids from the Aerial Parts ofSchizanthus tricolor, pp. 50-53 in Journal of Natural Products 74 (1) on page 50, DOI: 10.1021/np1005423, http://zenodo.org/record/4017373

criteria.title: Figure 1 in Schizanthines N, O, and P, Tropane Alkaloids from the Aerial Parts ofSchizanthus tricolor

criteria.title: Figure 2. Selected 1H-1H in Schizanthines N, O, and P, Tropane Alkaloids from the Aerial Parts ofSchizanthus tricolor
criteria.description: Figure 2. Selected 1H-1H COSY (dashed arrows) and 1H-13C HMBC (full arrows) correlations observed for compounds 1, 2, and 3.
criteria.notes: Published as part of Humam, Munir, Kehrli, Thomas, Jeannerat, Damien, Muñoz, Orlando, Hostettmann, Kurt & Christen, Philippe, 2011, Schizanthines N, O, and P, Tropane Alkaloids from the Aerial Parts ofSchizanthus tricolor, pp. 50-53 in Journal of Natural Products 74 (1) on page 51, DOI: 10.1021/np1005423, http://zenodo.org/record/4017373

criteria.title: Schizanthines N, O, and P, Tropane Alkaloids from the Aerial Parts ofSchizanthus tricolor
criteria.description: Humam, Munir, Kehrli, Thomas, Jeannerat, Damien, Muñoz, Orlando, Hostettmann, Kurt, Christen, Philippe (2011): Schizanthines N, O, and P, Tropane Alkaloids from the Aerial Parts ofSchizanthus tricolor. Journal of Natural Products 74 (1): 50-53, DOI: 10.1021/np1005423, URL: http://dx.doi.org/10.1021/np1005423
references: (1) Perez, F. Evolution de la integracion floral en el genero Schizanthus (Solanaceae) en asociation a los sistemas de polinizacion. Ph.D. Thesis, Universidad de Chile, Santiago, 2004; p 10.
(2) Cretton, S.; Glauser, G.; Humam, M.; Jeannerat, D.; Munoz, O.; Maes, L.; Christen, P.; Hostettmann, K. J. Nat. Prod. 2010, 73, 844-847.
(3) Griffin, W. J.; Lin, G. D. Phytochemistry 2000, 53, 623-637.
(4) Lounasmaa, M.; Tamminen, T. In The Tropane Alkaloids; Cordell, G. A., Ed.; Academic Press: San Diego, 1993; Vol. 44, Chapter 1, pp1-114.
(5) Munoz, O.; Schneider, C.; Breitmaier, E. Liebigs Ann. Chem. 1994, 521-522.
(6) Pena, R. C.; Munoz, O. Biochem. Syst. Ecol. 2002, 30, 45-53.
(7) Bieri, S.; Munoz, O.; Veuthey, J.-L.; Christen, P. J. Sep. Sci. 2006, 29, 96-102.
(8) Bieri, S.; Varesio, E.; Munoz, O.; Veuthey, J.-L.; Christen, P. J. Pharm. Biomed. Anal. 2006, 40, 545-551.
(9) Bieri, S.; Varesio, E.; Veuthey, J.-L.; Munoz, O.; Tseng, L.-H.; Braumann, U.; Spraul, M.; Christen, P. Phytochem. Anal. 2006, 17, 78-86.
(10) Humam, M.; Munoz, O.; Christen, P.; Hostettmann, K. Nat. Prod. Commun. 2007, 2, 743-747.
(11) Bourguignon, J.-J.; Schoenfelder, A.; Schmitt, M.; Wermuth, C.-G.; Hechler, V.; Charlier, B.; Maitre, M. J. Med. Chem. 1988, 31, 893- 897.
(12) Khan, A. T.; Blessing, B.; Schmidt, R. R. Synthesis 1994, 255-257.
(13) Yagudaev, M. R.; Aripova, S. F. Chem. Nat. Compd. 1986, 22, 74- 78.
(14) Humam, M.; Christen, P.; Munoz, O.; Hostettmann, K.; Jeannerat, D. Chirality 2008, 20, 20-25.
(15) Agar, J. T. H.; Evans, W. C. J. Chem. Soc., Perkin Trans. 1 1976, 1550-1553.
(16) El-Iman, Y. M. S.; Evans, W. C.; Grout, R. J.; Ramsey, K. P. A. Phytochemistry 1987, 26, 2386-2389.
(17) Al-Said, M. S.; Evans, W. C.; Grout, R. J. J. Chem. Soc., Perkin Trans. 1 1986, 957-959.
(18) Al-Said, M. S.; Evans, W. C.; Grout, R. J. Phytochemistry 1989, 28, 671-673.
(19) Bringmann, G.; Gunther, C.; Muhlbacher, J.; Lalith, M. D.; Gunathilake, P.; Wickramasinghe, A. Phytochemistry 2000, 53, 409-416.
(20) Robins, R. J.; Bachmann, P.; Robinson, T.; Rhodes, M. J. C.; Yamada, Y. FEBS Lett. 1991, 292, 293-297.

criteria.title: IUPAC FAIRSpec-ready aggregations: Recommendations for researchers, authors, and publishers

creators.name: Chalk, Stuart
creators.affiliation: University of North Florida: Jacksonville, FL, US

creators.name: Lancashire, Robert J.
creators.affiliation: The University of the West Indies

criteria.description:
This is a presentation of IUPAC FAIRSpec project. It was presented at the workshop titled “Advancing FAIR Chemistry: Developing New Services for Sharing Chemical Data”. The event took place during the ACS spring meeting in Indianapolis, US, on March 27, 2023.

*WorldFAIR “Global cooperation on FAIR data policy and practice” is funded by the EC HORIZON-WIDERA-2021-ERA-01-41 Coordination and Support Action under Grant Agreement No. 101058393.

grants.title: Global cooperation on FAIR data policy and practice

criteria.title: NMRium: ReactJS component to display and process NMR spectra
criteria.description: Software that allows to visualize and process 1D and 2D NMR spectra. Visit https://www.nmrium.org or https://docs.nmrium.org to get more information.
